questions.question: PROMISES: What promises were made? (E.g. pledges to build houses, lower taxes or to waive education fees.
WHAT CONCERNS OR ISSUES WERE RAISED BY THE AUDIENCE?
HECKLERS: Disrupt proceedings by hard shouting or harassing speakers. Listen carefully - what they say can add colour to your story? Also note the responses from speakers, organisers and audiences.
THE UNEXPECTED: Did anything unexpected, quirky or unusual happen?
CONTRADICTIONS: Did any of the speakers make contradictory statements or shifts from their party’s policies?
MOOD: what is the mood of the rally/meeting? (Tense, light-hearted, trouble makers in the crowd etc)
THE CROWD: How big was it? (Even if they differ, ensure you quote a variety of sources: your estimates, the police, the organisers, stadium management etc)
questions.description:
_Tip: Count the number of people in a section of the crowd. Then estimate out how many similar sized sections there are and multiply these by the number of people in the section you counted to get a rough estimate)_

Answer:

questions.question: SECURITY: What security (Police, army, private security etc) is there and how they armed?
ANY OPPOSITION SUPPORTERS: Were they armed, even with stones, and how did they behave?
ANY COMMOTIONS OR VIOLENCE:  (You may have missed something so don’t jump to conclusions if something happens. Interview as many people as possible)
RIGHT OF REPLY: Did any speakers attack political opponents? Get a response from those who were attacked)
CONTACT DETAILS OF ORGANISERS AND PEOPLE YOU INTERVIEWED
Adapted from the International Federation of Journalists ELECTION REPORTING HANDBOOK
